command:
import os, json, logging, sys
from kubernetes import client, config
from kubernetes.stream import stream

logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(message)s')
ns = os.getenv('KUBE_NAMESPACE', 'default')
pod = os.getenv('KUBE_POD', 'util-python-0')
container = os.getenv('KUBE_CONTAINER')
try:
    try:
        config.load_incluster_config()
    except Exception:
        config.load_kube_config()
    v1 = client.CoreV1Api()
    inner = "import os, sys, json, logging, requests; logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO); domain=os.environ.get('TARGET_DOMAIN','example.com'); headers={'APIKEY': os.environ['SECURITYTRAILS_KEY']}; url=f'https://api.securitytrails.com/v1/domain/{domain}/subdomains';\ntry:\n    r=requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=15); r.raise_for_status(); print(json.dumps({'source':'securitytrails','domain':domain,'data':r.json()}))\nexcept Exception as e:\n    print(json.dumps({'source':'securitytrails','domain':domain,'error':str(e)})); sys.exit(1)"
    resp = stream(v1.connect_get_namespaced_pod_exec, pod, ns, command=['python3','-c', inner], container=container, stderr=True, stdin=False, stdout=True, tty=False)
    print(resp)
except Exception as e:
    logging.error('collection_failed', exc_info=e); sys.exit(1)
